meanings.sent1: The fireproof safe kept all our important documents safe from the flames.
meanings.sent2: The fireproof curtains prevented the fire from spreading to other rooms.
meanings.sent3: The fireproof jacket made the firefighter look like a superhero.
meanings.sent4: Her heart was like a fireproof fortress, impervious to the flames of betrayal.
meanings.sent5: The fireproof material glowed red but remained unscathed by the intense heat.

meanings.sent1: The fireproof building stood tall amidst the blazing inferno.
meanings.sent2: The fireproof glass windows remained intact even after the explosion.
meanings.sent3: The fireproof oven mitts saved her hands from getting burned while baking.
meanings.sent4: His resolve was like a fireproof shield, protecting him from the harsh criticisms.
meanings.sent5: The fireproof structure emerged from the fire unharmed, a testament to its durability.

meanings.definition: To make something resistant to fire.
meanings.sent1: The company decided to fireproof the warehouse after the previous fire incident.
meanings.sent2: She carefully fireproofed the attic to protect it from any potential fire hazards.
meanings.sent3: The firefighters worked tirelessly to fireproof the entire neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: He wanted to fireproof his memories, to shield them from the flames of time.
meanings.sent5: The villagers came together to fireproof their homes against the forest fires.
